channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Open bin bags on Merrow street, 15th January
item.description:
Several open bing bags dumped on Merrow street. Seem to contain soiled clothes, nappies(?) and other waste. Have appeared overnight with contents spilling onto the pavement. This seems to be a persistent trend of flytipping on this road. Would be good if street cleaners could address this as the flytippers waste is appearing almost daily and often being left for extended periods of time without being cleaned up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Merrow Street, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous potholes and road surface damage, 15th January
item.description:
The majority of Harland Avenue has cracks, potholes, surface erosion or damage. It is a relatively busy road which is in urgent need of resurfacing rather than repairing sections.

item.title: Huge Potholes, 15th January
item.description:

item.title: Barriers in parking bays, 15th January
item.description:
As suggested by the planning enforcement department, I am reporting barriers again being placed in parking bays. This parking is for little birches and should not be blocked by the developers. Please investigate.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 55, Little Birches, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights over the footbridge between Pembroke Road and West Street over Bronze Age Way are not working, 15th January
item.description:
Street lights over the footbridge between Pembroke Road and West Street over Bronze Age Way are not working - been reported before and nothing has been done. It is really dangerous when dark and crossing the bridge and also cameras should be put up there as there's groups of boys that hang around there in balaclavas...please can this be looked at asap
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bronze Age Way, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog fouling, 15th January
item.description:
Dog fouling on pathway to block and caretaker has not washed it away it was there 530am and still there with a foot print where someone has trod in it Needs cleaning up

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: So many abandoned vehicles, 15th January
item.description:
Along the whole of Nathan way are vehicles that have been abandoned. There many cars that have no number plates and I am sure that none of them are taxed or insured. These vehicles have been there for weeks if not months and are an eyesore. Vehicles that are neither taxed or insured should not be on the road as you know it's illegal. Please can these vehicles be taken away. I am sure if you turned up to start the removal of them, the owners will then move the rest if indeed they have owners. I am certain that if I parked my own vehicle without tax and insurance something would be done immediately, however these vehicles have just been left there for a very long time and is unacceptable!
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Nathan Way, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish not collected, being attacked by foxes, 15th January
item.description:
I am reporting this again,nothing has been done,despite my 1st report being updated to fixed, the rubbish is still there piling up and not emptied.i did present my rubbish for collection and it was not collected.it was presented from the night before. It is a lie that it was put where it should of been. It's been over a week now the rubbish is uncollected,smelling and foxes attacking the bins. This needs to be collected and emptied ASAP please

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marlow Road, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
